message.content:
cs.DB, cs.IR, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CL. 

This paper deals with the problem of linking records that refer to entities in the same group, which is a common task in data management and information retrieval. The paper presents a two-stage algorithm that is designed to handle the challenges of group linkage, such as high tolerance for value diversity and scalability. Given these characteristics, the most likely sub-category is cs.DB (databases), which deals with the storage, retrieval, and management of large amounts of data. Other likely sub-categories include cs.IR (information retrieval), which deals with the search and retrieval of information from large collections of data, cs.DS (data structures and algorithms), which deals with the design and analysis of efficient algorithms for processing large data sets, cs.AI (artificial intelligence), which deals with the development of intelligent systems that can learn from data, and cs.CL (computational linguistics), which deals with the processing and analysis of natural language data.
